meanings.definition: A list of people or items waiting for something
meanings.sent1: The school had long waitlists for popular classes.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's waitlists were full every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The zoo animals decided to create their own waitlists for the best food.
meanings.sent4: The shelves in the library were like waitlists, patiently holding books until they were borrowed.
meanings.sent5: The waitlists at the amusement park were as long as a line of ants marching towards a picnic.

meanings.definition: To place on a list of people or items waiting for something
meanings.sent1: She waitlists her favorite books to borrow from the library.
meanings.sent2: The airline waitlists passengers when all seats are taken.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly waitlists his friends for the next movie night.
meanings.sent4: The chef waitlists the fresh ingredients for the evening's special dish.
meanings.sent5: The teacher waitlists students who want extra help after class.
